Hello Everyone,
I wanted to ask a question related to reactor1.m which is in the 
matlab demos section in cantera. In the program we set the 
temperature to 1001K and Pressure to OneAtm and also specify the 
number of moles of H2:2, O2:1, N2:4. After this the gas is inserted 
in the reactor and a simulation is carried out. My question is the 
reactor volume is given a default value of 1m3 at the beginning of 
the simulation. My question is when we have set the temperature, 
pressure and number of moles inserted in the reactor, shouldnt the 
reactor have a volume different from the default value of 1m3? 
(approximately the value obtained from the ideal gas formula?)

Surinder
